5. OT Policy

5.1

If an employee's overtime exceeds "X" minutes, then it requires mandatory approval.

Edit policy

5.1: If an employee's overtime exceeds "X" minutes, then it requires mandatory approval.

This new policy will be effective from 15th Jun 2022 onwards.

5.2

If an employee performs a PUNCH IN before the specified shift time, they will be eligible for overtime with the shift start time being defined as the START TIME.

Edit policy

5.2: If an employee performs a PUNCH IN before the specified shift time, they will be eligible for overtime with the shift start time being defined as the START TIME.

This new policy will be effective from 15th Jun 2022 onwards.

5.3

Additional time worked by an employee beyond X hours in a shift will be recorded as "OVERTIME".

Edit policy

5.3: Additional time worked by an employee beyond X hours in a shift will be recorded as "OVERTIME".

This new policy will be effective from 15th Jun 2022 onwards.

5.4

 If an employee continues to work after the designated Shift End Time or Regular Out Time, then any additional hours will be considered as OVERTIME.

Edit policy

5.4: If an employee continues to work after the designated Shift End Time or Regular Out Time, then any additional hours will be considered as OVERTIME.

This new policy will be effective from 15th Jun 2022 onwards.

5.5

If an employee works during a public holiday, their working hours will be recorded as OVERTIME.

Edit policy

5.5: If an employee works during a public holiday, their working hours will be recorded as OVERTIME.

This new policy will be effective from 15th Jun 2022 onwards.

5.6

If an employee works during their designated weekly day off, then their working hours will be considered as "OVERTIME."

Edit policy

5.6: If an employee works during their designated weekly day off, then their working hours will be considered as "OVERTIME."

This new policy will be effective from 15th Jun 2022 onwards.

5.7

If OT hours are greater than or equal to X hours and less than Y hours, a Half Day will be allotted. if the OT hours are greater than or equal to Y hours, a Full Day will be allotted.

Edit policy

5.7: If OT hours are greater than or equal to X hours and less than Y hours, a Half Day will be allotted. if the OT hours are greater than or equal to Y hours, a Full Day will be allotted.

This new policy will be effective from 15th Jun 2022 onwards.

5.8

When an employee works for X consecutive days, their hours will be marked as 'Overtime'.

Edit policy

5.8: When an employee works for X consecutive days, their hours will be marked as 'Overtime'.

This new policy will be effective from 15th Jun 2022 onwards.

Edit policy

5.10

Edit policy

5.10: If OT hours are greater than or equal to X hours and less than Y hours, a Half Day Comp off will be allotted. if the OT hours are greater than or equal to Y hours, a Full Day Comp off will be allotted.

This new policy will be effective from 15th Jun 2022 onwards.

7.2

If an employee works on a weekoff, the working hours are greater than or equal to X hours and less than Y hours, 1.5X Present will be allotted. if the working hours are greater than or equal to Y hours, a 2X Present will be allotted.

Edit policy

This new policy will be effective from 15th Jun 2022 onwards.
